availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Drury James Burchett (Lawrence County blacksmith, soldier, and politician)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, blacksmith, soldier, and politician. Floyd County, Kentucky, native. Son of Armstead Burchett and Rebecca Pigg Burchett. Attended school in Louisa, Lawrence County, Kentucky. Married to Addie Jones Burchett on March 15, 1865. Resident in Lawrence County in 1850. Blacksmith in Lawrence County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant, captain, and major from June 30, 1861 to January 31, 1865. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky representing Boyd and Lawrence counties in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 75A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 657.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Precinct 9, p. 280.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 271.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 872.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lawrence County Marriages, Film #000840550 p. 375.
John M. Gresham, Biographical Cyclopedia of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, (Chicago and Philadelphia, USA: John M. Gresham, 1896), p. 358-359.
Kentucky Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #7017544, All Counties Deaths, p. 883.
